Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the presence of ISIS in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or credible sources to support the assertion that ISIS is present in Ciudad Juarez.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that if unaccompanied minors can cross the border, trained terrorists can as well, without providing evidence for this assumption.
Contradict fact: The federal government asserts that there is currently no credible threat of ISIS planning an attack on US soil, contradicting the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: Law enforcement officials suggest that it is much more likely for ISIS and other extremists to enter the US by commercial plane rather than crossing the southern border.
